poem:
**Festival Marquee**

Under London's drape of drizzle,  
the lights flicker like sequins;  
films spool dreams across screens,  
each story unspooled thread by thread.  
Swift notes spiral through October air,  
where cinema dances with melodies—  
a fusion, fleeting as fall's leaf,  
yet lingering as autumn's embrace.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "From the BFI London film festival to Taylor Swift: your complete entertainment guide to the week ahead Going out: Cinema BFI London film festival8 to 19 OctoberThe annual smorgasbord of cinema returns to the UK capital (and beyond, via various regional satellite screenings), offering a selection of the best major international festival premieres, from Cannes to Venice. Catch the latest from Richard Linklater and Lynne Ramsay, as well as Guillermo del Toro’s new Frankenstein. UrchinOut". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
